Join us in powering the progress of global aerospace.Position Overview:Boeing India Engineering is seeking an Experienced Desktop Hardware Architect to join the Client Computing team. As a member of this team, you will work closely with Business Success Leaders to ensure seamless delivery of desktop services and provide a stable desktop environment to the enterprise. This will include collecting and analyzing business requirements, recommending improvements, participating in design and architecture discussions and serve as third level support for Desktop related technical issues.  The successful candidate will have a strong knowledge of software/hardware design and have the ability to work across IT solutions in a multi-platform environment. This position will be located in the Boeing India Engineering and Technology Center, Bangalore, India.Position Responsibilities:Consult with the business on desktop computer hardware configurations and issues
Perform as a technical advisor to the organizational Business Liaisons and Business Success leaders on desktop computer hardware topics
Coordinate with suppliers to complete hardware evaluations, address technical and delivery concerns
Review and assess non-standard deviation requests, i.e. waivers, for desktop productivity software and desktop computer hardware
Maintain desktop hardware architecture artifacts (requirements, standards, catalog, etc.)
Shared/Group mailbox management, contribute to team InSite pageEMPLOYER WILL NOT SPONSOR APPLICANTS FOR EMPLOYMENT VISA STATUS.Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or related work experience
7+ years of experience supporting Operating Systems (e.g. Windows 7, Windows 10, or Linux/Unix) and User Productivity systems (e.g. Microsoft Office 365)
7+ years of experience with desktop hardware architecture and solutions (e.g. Mac Hardware, Thin Client hardware, Factory/Industrial PCs)
7+ years of experience implementing/managing complex End-User solutions IT
